# Discord Chat Analysis for ğŸ’»â”‚developers

## 1. Summary
The chat segment discusses UI and 3D model development for what appears to be a web-based 3D application. 3rdEyeVisuals mentioned working on model panel frames, which prompted a technical discussion about mesh properties. Roustan was having trouble with a file in Blender and was seeking a code-based solution. Ash provided a code snippet to disable shadow casting on meshes using JavaScript. The conversation also touched on Blender add-ons for the platform, with Ash sharing a specific GitHub link to the add-on they use. 3rdEyeVisuals mentioned they're developing a SaaS model and will make a PR for UI z-indexing improvements. The discussion highlights the community's focus on improving the developer experience through both code solutions and tooling.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How can I disable shadow casting on a mesh using code? (asked by ğ•½ğ–”ğ–šğ–˜ğ–™ğ–†ğ–“) A: Use `mesh.castShadow = false` or with a specific mesh: `const mesh = app.get('MyMesh'); mesh.castShadow = false` (answered by ash)
Q: Where can I find the Blender add-on? (implied by conversation) A: https://github.com/hyperfy-xyz/hyperfy/blob/main/docs/extras/blender-addon.py (answered by ash)

## 3. Help Interactions

No technical discussions, decisions, or problem-solving occurred in this chat segment. The only message was from user Rick sharing a link to Bitcoin Hyper on DexScreener with market metrics showing HYPER/WETH trading pair at $7M with 337K% (presumably referring to price movement or liquidity).
